chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.```", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
s: seq R

Goal:
sorted Rle s <-> ordered_Rlist (seq2Rlist s)

Premises:
Notation seq := list
ordered_Rlist = fun l : Rlist => forall i : nat, (i < Init.Nat.pred (Rlength l))%nat -> pos_Rl l i <= pos_Rl l (S i) : Rlist -> Prop
sorted = fix sorted (T : Type) (Ord : T -> T -> Prop) (s : seq T) {struct s} : Prop := match s with | [::] => True | [:: h0] => True | h0 :: (h1 :: _) as t0 => Ord h0 h1 /\ sorted T Ord t0 end : forall T : Type, (T -> T -> Prop) -> seq T -> Prop Argument T is implicit and maximally inserted Argument scopes are [type_scope function_scope seq_scope]
Rle = fun r1 r2 : R => r1 < r2 \/ r1 = r2 : R -> R -> Prop Argument scopes are [R_scope R_scope]
seq2Rlist = fix seq2Rlist (s : seq R) : Rlist := match s with | [::] => nil | h :: t => cons h (seq2Rlist t) end : seq R -> Rlist Argument scope is [seq_scope]
Rlist2seq_bij : forall s : seq R, Rlist2seq (seq2Rlist s) = s
size_compat : forall s : seq R, Rlength (seq2Rlist s) = size s
nth_compat : forall (s : seq R) (n : nat), pos_Rl (seq2Rlist s) n = nth 0 s n
sorted_last : forall (s : seq R) (i : nat), sorted Rle s -> (i < size s)%nat -> forall x0 : R, nth x0 s i <= last x0 s
sorted_head : forall (s : seq R) (i : nat), sorted Rle s -> (i < size s)%nat -> forall x0 : R, head x0 s <= nth x0 s i
sorted_incr : forall (s : seq R) (i j : nat), sorted Rle s -> (i <= j)%nat -> (j < size s)%nat -> forall x0 : R, nth x0 s i <= nth x0 s j
sorted_dec : forall (s : seq R) (x0 x : R), sorted Rle s -> head x0 s <= x <= last x0 s -> {i : nat | nth x0 s i <= x < nth x0 s (S i) /\ (S (S i) < size s)%nat} + {nth x0 s (size s - 2) <= x <= nth x0 s (size s - 1)}
seq2Rlist_bij : forall s : Rlist, seq2Rlist (Rlist2seq s) = s
sorted_nth : forall (Ord : ?T -> ?T -> Prop) (s0 : seq ?T), sorted Ord s0 < -> (forall i : nat, (i < Init.Nat.pred (size s0))%nat -> forall x0 : ?T, Ord (nth x0 s0 i) (nth x0 s0 (S i))) where ?T : [s : seq R |- Type]
RList_P6 : forall l : Rlist, ordered_Rlist l < -> (forall i j : nat, (i <= j)%nat -> (j < Rlength l)%nat -> pos_Rl l i <= pos_Rl l j)
sorted_cat : forall (Ord : ?T -> ?T -> Prop) (s1 s2 : seq ?T) (x0 : ?T), sorted Ord s1 -> sorted Ord s2 -> Ord (last x0 s1) (head x0 s2) -> sorted Ord (s1 ++ s2) where ?T : [s : seq R |- Type]
cats0 : forall (T : Type) (s : seq T), s ++ [::] = s
RList_P25 : forall l1 l2 : Rlist, ordered_Rlist l1 -> ordered_Rlist l2 -> pos_Rl l1 (Init.Nat.pred (Rlength l1)) <= pos_Rl l2 0 -> ordered_Rlist (cons_Rlist l1 l2)
RList_P2 : forall l1 l2 : Rlist, ordered_Rlist l2 -> ordered_Rlist (cons_ORlist l1 l2)
nth0 : forall (T : Type) (x0 : T) (s : seq T), nth x0 s 0 = head x0 s
RList_P4 : forall (l1 : Rlist) (a : R), ordered_Rlist (cons a l1) -> ordered_Rlist l1
RList_P1 : forall (l : Rlist) (a : R), ordered_Rlist l -> ordered_Rlist (insert l a)
nth_last : forall (T : Type) (x0 : T) (s : seq T), nth x0 s (Init.Nat.pred (size s)) = last x0 s
SSR_leq : forall n m : nat, ssrnat.leq n m < -> (n <= m)%nat
iffLR : forall P Q : Prop, P < -> Q -> P -> Q
MyNat.le_pred_le_succ : forall n m : nat, (Init.Nat.pred n <= m)%nat < -> (n <= S m)%nat
Rlist2seq = fix Rlist2seq (s : Rlist) : seq R := match s with | nil => [::] | cons h t => h :: Rlist2seq t end : Rlist -> seq R
SubEqui_P7 : forall (a b : R) (del : posreal) (h : a < b), ordered_Rlist (SubEqui del h)
head = fun (T : Type) (x0 : T) (s : seq T) => match s with | [::] => x0 | x :: _ => x end : forall T : Type, T -> seq T -> T Argument T is implicit and maximally inserted Argument scopes are [type_scope _ seq_scope]
size = fun T : Type => fix size (s : seq T) : nat := match s with | [::] => 0%nat | _ :: s' => S (size s') end : forall T : Type, seq T -> nat Argument T is implicit and maximally inserted Argument scopes are [type_scope seq_scope]
last = fun T : Type => fix last (x : T) (s : seq T) {struct s} : T := match s with | [::] => x | x' :: s' => last x' s' end : forall T : Type, T -> seq T -> T Argument T is implicit and maximally inserted Argument scopes are [type_scope _ seq_scope]
Inductive list (A : Type) : Type := nil : seq A | cons : A -> seq A -> seq A For nil: Arguments are renamed to T For cons: Arguments are renamed to T, x, s For nil: Argument T is implicit and maximally inserted For cons: Argument T is implicit and maximally inserted For list: Argument scope is [type_scope] For nil: Argument scope is [type_scope] For cons: Argument scopes are [type_scope _ seq_scope]
sumbool_ind : forall (A B : Prop) (P : {A} + {B} -> Prop), (forall a : A, P (left a)) -> (forall b : B, P (right b)) -> forall s : {A} + {B}, P s
sig_rec : forall (A : Type) (P : A -> Prop) (P0 : {x : A | P x} -> Set), (forall (x : A) (p : P x), P0 (exist P x p)) -> forall s : {x : A | P x}, P0 s
nth = fun (T : Type) (x0 : T) => fix nth (s : seq T) (n : nat) {struct n} : T := match s with | [::] => x0 | x :: s' => match n with | 0%nat => x | S n' => nth s' n' end end : forall T : Type, T -> seq T -> nat -> T Argument T is implicit and maximally inserted Argument scopes are [type_scope _ seq_scope nat_scope]
